page.title: 16...BIOGRAPHY
page.content: John March was born in China in 1939.He lived in China for six years.Part of the time was spent in a concentration camp. Then he came to England.He began school when he was 6 years old.He moved to Bristol where he went to a boys' school.He went to Cambridge University to study Law and Economics.Then he trained in Lincoln to become a priest. He was a curate in Sheldon, Birmingham and vicar of Bromford and Firs from 1968. His mother and father have died in recent years. He would have liked to have married. He has enjoyed his life. He played cricket and hockey.He enjoys music,singing and playing instruments, walking in the countryside.He loves dogs.He is concerned about the ways people treat each other. John March moved to St. James' Church, Handsworth on 3rd July,1985.
